author: Reuters Editorial
title: German stocks - Factors to watch on February 23
text:
FRANKFURT, Feb 23 (Reuters) - The following are some of the factors that may move German stocks on Friday:
ALLIANZ German utility EWE will put a $1.9 billion minority stake on the block later this year, a sale that is expected to draw interest from groups including Allianz Capital Partners, two people familiar with the matter said.
BMW BMW agreed to pay more than $2.2 million to settle U.S. government claims that it failed to provide required refunds to 492 military personnel who lawfully terminated their vehicle leases because they were called to duty.
VOLKSWAGEN Q4 results due. Operating profit seen up 24 percent at 4.15 billion euros. Poll:
TELEFONICA DEUTSCHLAND Capital Markets Day due.
XING The group proposed to raise its dividend for 2017 by 23 percent to 1.68 per share.
Separately, preliminary fourth-quarter results.
RHOEN-KLINIKUM
Q4 results due.
EX-DIVIDEND
INFINEON - dividend 0.25 eur/shr
ANALYSTSâ€™ VIEWS
STROEER - Barclays cuts target price to 69.50 euros from 72 euros
OVERSEAS STOCK MARKETS Dow Jones +0.7 pct, S&P 500 +0.1 pct, Nasdaq -0.1 pct at close.
Nikkei +0.7 pct, Shanghai stocks +0.1 pct.
Time: 5.52 GMT.
GERMAN ECONOMIC DATA German detailed Q4 GDP expected at 0700 GMT. Seen +0.6 pct q/q, +2.3 pct y/y.
EUROPEAN FACTORS TO WATCH DIARIES REUTERS TOP NEWS (Reporting by Christoph Steitz and Tom Sims)
